lines.text:
[philisophically]
Ah, well, being in love ain't going to hurt him. Ain't no harm in that. It's getting hitched is where the trouble begins.

[Suspicious and jealous of Milly]
What's in that letter?
Well, you needn't be so jealous of her. There's a place here for both of you if you know your place.
I'm not your mother. Call me Jane if the name Mrs. Jett makes yuh jealous.
Jealous? Why I don't know what you mean.
You're no more related to Jett than I am

Hunh... I guess Jett's just as glad of that as you are, but you needn't worry about it... just as long as I'm alive. Why don't you take up with one of the boys. You still could get one redy enough to fight your step-father off when he gets 'funny.'
I don't know what Sprague's gonna say to you gittin' married, totin' that young gal along. I'm gain' it 'cause I'm agin all women.
Hoe many times you been married, Jude?
Still thinkin' about that gal, ain't yuh?
No. Anybody wo can't forget a gal in four weeks oughta be talked to.
Where there's hunters, there's hides, and where there's hides, there's thieves.
Well, if there's gonna be a weddin', better shave.
